question: 1. What is the purpose of using views in architectural descriptions?
options: a) To create a detailed diagram of the system
b) To structure the description into different aspects of the system
d) To hide complex details from developers
c) To simplify the architecture for non-technical stakeholders
correct_answer: a) To create a detailed diagram of the system

question: 2. How is the relationship between view and viewpoint compared in software architecture?
options: a) Similar to parent and child
d) Similar to function and method
b) Similar to object and class
c) Similar to system and module
correct_answer: a) Similar to parent and child

question: 3. Which academic roots can be traced back to the concept of architectural viewpoints?
options: d) Jeff Garland and Richard Anthony
b) Philippe Kruchten
c) Reference Model of Open Distributed Processing (RM-ODP)
a) David Garlan and Mary Shaw
correct_answer: d) Jeff Garland and Richard Anthony

question: 4. What is the purpose of the Reference Model of Open Distributed Processing (RM-ODP)?
options: d) To define software architecture principles
a) To describe distributed object systems and viewpoints
c) To standardize architectural descriptions
b) To provide guidelines for software development
correct_answer: d) To define software architecture principles

question: 7. How does the set of viewpoints in "Perspectives" differ from others in software architecture?
options: d) It is aimed at hardware systems
b) It includes only technical aspects
a) It is practitioner-focused
c) It is based on academic research
correct_answer: d) It is aimed at hardware systems

question: 9. What is the role of viewpoints in software architecture?
options: d) To define hardware requirements
c) To hide complexity from developers
a) To create detailed diagrams of the system
b) To structure the architecture into different aspects

question: 10. Which standard is used to describe distributed object systems and their viewpoint set?
options: a) UML
d) ACM SIGSOFT
c) IEEE
b) ISO's Reference Model of Open Distributed Processing (RM-ODP)
